key_points: Hurricane Ida caused an oil spill at the Phillips 66 Alliance Refinery in Belle Chasse, Louisiana, affecting wildlife.
Wildlife officials have found more than 100 birds covered in oil near the site of the spill.
The Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries (LDWF) is investigating the incident and expects to find more affected birds.
Affected wildlife includes various species of birds, alligators, river otters, and nutria.
Some of the oiled birds have been captured and are being rehabilitated.
The US Coast Guard is investigating 350 reported incidents of oil spills following Hurricane Ida.
Crews are conducting hazard assessments to prioritize threats to the environment and navigable waterways.
The Environmental Protection Agency has received 43 reports of significant inland oil spills and chemical releases after Ida.
Phillips 66 did not initially respond to requests for comment but later acknowledged a sheen of unknown origin at the refinery.
The quantity of oil spilled has not been officially reported yet.
